title: ICC investigating alleged Russian war crimes in Ukraine
description: Fierce fighting for control of the southern Ukrainian city of Kherson left dozens dead as Russia's onslaught against multiple Ukrainian cities intensified Wednesday and fears over the civilian toll mounted.

title: 'We're dealing with a different guy': Rubio on why Putin's moves will be different this time
description: Sen. Marco Rubio (R-FL) tells CNN's Jake Tapper why he thinks Russian President Putin's calculus of risk is different than in past scenarios.

title: 'Get rid of your president': Hear a refugee's message to the Russian people
description: CNN's Ivan Watson reports from Hungary, where one in seven refugees from Ukraine have arrived after fleeing their war-torn homes.

title: US warns of shift in Russian strategy: civilian targets and a 'slow annihilation' of military
description: • Analysis: Shift in Ukraine map makes Russia's intentions clearer

title: Russian billionaire to sell Chelsea FC
Ukraine wants Russia to be severed from the global internet. Experts say it's a risky idea
description: Over the past week, Ukraine's government has pressured major tech platforms to rethink how they operate with Russia, and it has been pretty successful. Social media companies have reduced the reach of Russian state-backed media outlets, for example, and Apple has stopped selling its products and limited some services in Russia.

title: Shifting Ukraine map makes Russia's intentions clearer
description: Switch on Russian state television, and the spectacle of war in Ukraine is rather bloodless.

title: Melinda French Gates opens up about her divorce: 'I couldn't trust what we had'
description: In an interview with CBS, Melinda French Gates opened up about her divorce from Bill Gates and her difficult journey towards healing.

title: New Dr. Seuss-inspired books emphasize inclusion
description: New books are coming to the wide Dr. Seuss canon -- and new creators are taking the reins from the late children's author to write stories that reflect Seussian whimsy and the diversity of his readership.

title: Rocket part expected to crash into moon on Friday in 'exciting' opportunity for scientists
description: A rocket part that's been careering around space for years is set to collide with the moon on Friday, and it will be the first time a chunk of space junk has unintentionally slammed into the lunar surface.

title: How the world of travel is responding to Russia's invasion of Ukraine
description: From professional sports to Hollywood to food and beverage, a wide range of industries have announced boycotts, bans and other forms of retaliation against Russia in response to its violent invasion of Ukraine.

title: Score one for the Bush family over Trump
description: On Tuesday night, Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton was forced into a May Republican primary runoff with George P. Bush, a victory for the Bush family in their long-running feud with former President Donald Trump.

title: How to talk to your kids about Ukraine, according to psychologists
description: Russia's attack on Ukraine has caused international outrage, and people around the world are feeling the stress and fear of watching the violence and wondering what will come next.

title: Why Biden's key Mideast allies aren't condemning Russia's Ukraine invasion
description: The United Arab Emirates surprised its Western allies last week when it abstained on a US-drafted United Nations Security Council resolution condemning Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Amanpour: These countries could convince Putin to stop attacking Ukraine
description: CNN's Christiane Amanpour discusses which countries could utilize their leverage with Russian President Vladimir Putin to help end the Ukraine conflict.

title: What the writer of 'We Lived Happily During the War' wants you to know about Ukraine
description: In recent days, Russia's attack on Ukraine has left many living in the country in a nightmare.

title: Exodus: The international companies pulling back from Russia
description: A growing number of international companies, including Apple, Disney and Ford, are dialing back operations in Russia over its invasion of Ukraine.

title: Growing isolation: Russia says economy is taking 'serious blows'
description: Russia's economic isolation is growing, piling further pressure on its tottering financial system.

title: These are the sports that Russia has been suspended from
description: As Russia continues its invasion of Ukraine, various international sports organizations have begun imposing sanctions on the country and its athletes.

title: Biden's State of the Union sends potent messages to Zelensky and Putin
What millions of us across the former Soviet Union already knew
description: This terrifying, world-changing conflict in Ukraine did not start in 2022. Nor did it start in 2014. It began a decade and a half ago when Russia invaded Georgia and got away with it.

title: Hits and misses from Joe Biden's State of the Union speech
description: President Joe Biden delivered his first State of the Union address amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine and lagging poll numbers in a midterm election year. CNN's Chris Cillizza reacts to the best and worst moments.

title: Novak Djokovic splits from his long-term coach Marian Vajda
description: Novak Djokovic has split with his long-term coach, Marian Vajda, who formed a part of the 20-time grand slam winner's team for the last 15 years.

title: Mom gave birth the day before Russia attacked. Now, she's stuck at the border
description: Non-Ukrainians who are trying to leave Ukraine for their home countries have told CNN they have been segregated and denied transportation out of the country by officials at the border. CNN's Arwa Damon reports from the Ukrainian-Polish border.

title: What does Putin want? These maps explain what he's after
description: Mountains, ports and flat ground: Geography plays a part in Putin's desire to control Ukraine. Author and Broadcaster Tim Marshall explains why.

title: Big companies aren't shy about raising prices
description: Consumers are feeling the pinch from inflation, and that will likely continue for the foreseeable future. That's because major companies have been raising prices to protect their profit margins — and they are showing no signs of changing course anytime soon.

title: Texas GOP attorney general primary will head to runoff as Abbott and O'Rourke will win gubernatorial nominations, CNN projects
description: Texas Republicans will need a runoff to decide who their nominee for state attorney general will be in November with the incumbent, Ken Paxton, projected by CNN on Tuesday to fall short of a clinching majority.

title: 'There's still blood on the ground': CNN reporter visits site of TV tower attack
description: CNN's Alex Marquardt reports on the aftermath of a deadly Russian attack that hit a TV tower in Ukraine. Despite Russia's claim that they aren't targeting civilians, there is extensive damage to civilian buildings.

title: If the past is anything to go by, Russia will struggle to occupy Ukraine
description: Ukraine's resistance to the Russian invasion has shown strength that has surprised many observers, but one expert has warned historical precedent bodes poorly for Moscow's forces in the long term should it be unable to subdue the country quickly.

title: New York's raunchiest cabaret singer paints a disarmingly genuine portrait of middle America
description: Please note: Spoilers follow for the season finale of "Somebody Somewhere."

title: Oleksandr Usyk: 'My soul belongs to God and my body to my country,' says heavyweight champion after joining Ukrainian defense battalion
description: Ukrainian boxers Oleksandr Usyk and Vasiliy Lomachenko are childhood friends. They grew up dreaming of fighting their way to fame and glory, and together they conquered the world with their fists.

title: Tennis star Elina Svitolina says all prize money she wins at Monterrey Open will go to Ukrainian army
description: Ukrainian tennis star Elina Svitolina says she will donate all the prize money she wins at the Monterrey Open to the Ukrainian army.

title: Video shows aftermath of Kharkiv missile strikes
description: The regional police department and Kharkiv National University were targeted in a military strike Wednesday morning, according to Ukraine's State Emergency Service and videos geolocated by CNN.

title: 'Putin has decided to destroy the whole world'
description: In London, a sister remembers her brother killed on Ukraine's frontline. In Glasgow, a truck driver gets a call from his wife in Lviv: war has arrived in their homeland. In New York, a poet who fled Odessa contemplates his mother tongue. And in Kyiv, a journalist bunkers down for the long haul.

title: Burnt-out cargo ship carrying thousands of luxury cars sinks
description: The Felicity Ace which caught fire on February 16 while carrying thousands of cars, including Lamborghinis and Porsches, finally sank while being towed back to shore.

title: Opposition to Putin's war is alive on Moscow's streets -- but not Russian TV
description: • Zelensky makes dramatic plea to European Parliament

title: The art world responds to Russian invasion of Ukraine by canceling shows and cutting ties
description: Stage curtains are closing, art exhibitions are being halted and performers are being replaced. Over the past week, major cultural players worldwide -- including some within Russia -- have reacted to the invasion of Ukraine by canceling shows and applying pressure to the country's art institutions. So far, more than 500,000 refugees have fled Ukraine as the Kremlin continues its assault on the country's most populated cities, including the capital, Kyiv.

title: Philadelphia police shoot and kill teenager after he allegedly fired at officers
description: Philadelphia police shot and killed a suspect they believe is a teenager Tuesday night after he allegedly shot at four officers, authorities said.

title: Tampa Bay Buccaneers coach Bruce Arians says 'door is never closed' on Tom Brady
description: Tampa Bay Buccaneers head coach Bruce Arians says the "door is never closed" should legendary quarterback Tom Brady decide to reverse his retirement decision.

title: Under shadow of Ukraine invasion, US delegation signals support for Taiwan
description: As the world focuses on Russia's invasion of Ukraine, a delegation of former US defense officials has signaled American support for another democracy that's come under increasing pressure from an authoritarian power.

title: Military expert explains why urban fight will be a 'living nightmare' for Russia
description: California State Guard Col. John Spencer joins CNN's Don Lemon to discuss what could happen as the Russian invasion of Ukraine enters urban areas.

title: 4-year-old's 'case of the Mondays' caught on video
description: The pressures of preschool were just too much for a Kansas 4-year-old on a recent Monday morning. His dramatic driveway flop, caught on security camera video, has since gone viral. CNN affiliate KWCH has more.

title: Biden's State of the Union sends potent messages to Zelensky and Putin
description:
• 5 takeaways from Biden's speech
• Hits and misses from Biden's speech
• CNN political director on post-SOTU poll

title: 'It's my duty': World heavyweight boxing champ returns to Ukraine to fight
description: Current world heavyweight champ Oleksandr Usyk has returned home to take up arms in Ukraine. Speaking from a basement in the Kyiv area in an exclusive interview with Don Riddell, the 35-year-old fighter believes that boxing has prepared him for this terrifying scenario, even though his sport is the furthest thing from his mind at the moment.

title: Watch retiring Supreme Court justice's adorable reaction to Biden's shout-out
description: During the State of the Union address, President Joe Biden thanked Supreme Court Justice Breyer for his service and commitment ahead of his retirement.

title: Exxon is quitting its last Russian project
description: ExxonMobil pledged Tuesday to leave its last remaining oil-and-gas project in Russia, and it will not invest in new developments in the oil-rich country.

title: Slow progress for India's high-speed rail revolution
description: From Mumbai's packed commuter trains to overnight express mail trains akin to a city on wheels, and the astonishing Darjeeling & Himalayan "Toy Train," railways are one of India's most recognizable features.

title: With roadblocks, rifles and Ukrainian flags, Kyiv residents brace for arrival of huge Russian convoy
description: A drive through central Kyiv leaves no room for doubt. This is a city preparing for a major Russian attack.

title: Former UFC champion arrested in Bay Area shooting
description: Former UFC heavyweight champion Cain Velasquez was arrested in connection with a shooting in California's Bay Area, police said.

title: Teacher hits high school student on surveillance video
description: Video obtained by CNN shows a teacher striking a student at a high school in Elkhart, Indiana.
